styles.name: Abstract Art
styles.description: Non-representational forms and shapes emphasizing visual language over recognizable objects

styles.name: Abstract Expressionism
styles.description: Spontaneous, emotional, non-representational art with gestural brushwork and color fields

styles.name: Academic Art
styles.description: Highly finished style following classical traditions and formal rules of art academies

styles.name: Action Painting
styles.description: Dynamic, energetic application of paint with physical movement and gesture

styles.name: Aestheticism
styles.description: Art for art's sake movement emphasizing visual beauty over social themes

styles.name: Afrofuturism
styles.description: African diaspora culture combined with science fiction and futuristic elements

styles.name: American Barbizon
styles.description: Rural landscape painting inspired by French Barbizon school with atmospheric effects

styles.name: American Impressionism
styles.description: American adaptation of French Impressionism with local subjects and brighter palette

styles.name: American Scene Painting
styles.description: Realistic depictions of everyday American life and landscapes in the early 20th century

styles.name: Analytical Art
styles.description: Systematic approach to artistic creation using mathematical or scientific principles

styles.name: Art Brut
styles.description: Raw, outsider art created outside traditional art culture and training

styles.name: Art Deco
styles.description: Geometric shapes, bold colors, luxury materials, and streamlined forms of the 1920s-30s

styles.name: Art Informel
styles.description: European abstract art emphasizing spontaneous, intuitive creation

styles.name: Art Nouveau
styles.description: Organic forms, flowing lines, nature-inspired patterns and decorative elements

styles.name: Arte Povera
styles.description: Using unconventional, everyday materials to create profound artistic statements

styles.name: Arts and Crafts
styles.description: Traditional craftsmanship using simple forms and medieval, romantic styles

styles.name: ASCII Art
styles.description: Digital art created using text characters and symbols

styles.name: Ashcan School
styles.description: Realistic scenes of daily life in New York's poorer neighborhoods

styles.name: Assemblage
styles.description: Three-dimensional compositions created from found objects and mixed media

styles.name: Australian Tonalism
styles.description: Atmospheric landscapes with subtle tonal variations and muted colors

styles.name: Automatism
styles.description: Spontaneous creation without conscious control, often associated with Surrealism

styles.name: Baroque
styles.description: Dramatic, ornate, emotional intensity with rich colors and strong light-dark contrasts

styles.name: Bauhaus
styles.description: Functional design combining arts and crafts with industrial aesthetics

styles.name: Bengal School
styles.description: Indian art movement combining traditional Asian techniques with modern elements

styles.name: Bio Art
styles.description: Incorporating living tissues, bacteria, or biological processes in artwork

styles.name: Brutalism
styles.description: Raw concrete forms, exposed materials, and bold geometric shapes

styles.name: Byzantine Art
styles.description: Religious art characterized by golden mosaics, icons, and formal hierarchy

styles.name: Classical Realism
styles.description: Contemporary movement reviving traditional realistic painting techniques

styles.name: COBRA
styles.description: Spontaneous, primitive, colorful art inspired by children's drawings and folk art

styles.name: Color Field
styles.description: Large areas of flat color emphasizing emotional impact and spatial relationships

styles.name: Computer Art
styles.description: Art created or modified using computer software and digital tools

styles.name: Conceptual Art
styles.description: Ideas and concepts take precedence over traditional aesthetic and material concerns

styles.name: Constructivism
styles.description: Abstract, geometric art emphasizing industrial materials and social purpose

styles.name: Cubism
styles.description: Geometric shapes, multiple perspectives, fragmented and abstract forms

styles.name: Cynical Realism
styles.description: Chinese contemporary art movement expressing ironic and cynical views of society

styles.name: Cyberpunk
styles.description: High-tech dystopian aesthetic with neon colors and urban decay

styles.name: Dada
styles.description: Anti-art movement emphasizing absurdity, irony, and rejection of traditional values

styles.name: Dark Art
styles.description: Exploring macabre, gothic, and disturbing themes with emotional intensity

styles.name: De Stijl
styles.description: Pure abstraction using only straight lines, rectangular forms, and primary colors

styles.name: Digital Art
styles.description: Computer-generated or digitally manipulated imagery and effects

styles.name: Ecological Art
styles.description: Art addressing environmental issues and promoting ecological awareness

styles.name: Environmental Art
styles.description: Site-specific works integrating with or commenting on the natural environment

styles.name: Expressionism
styles.description: Distorted forms, intense colors, and emotional impact over realism

styles.name: Fauvism
styles.description: Wild, bold colors and loose brushwork expressing emotional intensity

styles.name: Feminist Art
styles.description: Art exploring and challenging gender issues and feminist themes

styles.name: Figurative Art
styles.description: Art retaining strong references to the real world, especially the human figure

styles.name: Folk Art
styles.description: Traditional art forms of the common people, often decorative and functional

styles.name: Futurism
styles.description: Dynamic movement, speed, and modern technology with geometric forms

styles.name: Generative Art
styles.description: Art created using autonomous systems, often computer algorithms

styles.name: Geometric Abstraction
styles.description: Non-objective art using geometric forms and mathematical principles

styles.name: Glitch Art
styles.description: Intentional digital errors, corrupted data, and technological artifacts

styles.name: Gothic
styles.description: Medieval style with pointed arches, elaborate stonework, and dramatic vertical elements

styles.name: Graffiti
styles.description: Street art using spray paint and other materials in public spaces

styles.name: Gutai
styles.description: Japanese avant-garde movement emphasizing physical interaction with materials

styles.name: Hard-edge Painting
styles.description: Abstract art with sharp, clean edges between areas of color

styles.name: Harlem Renaissance
styles.description: African American cultural movement celebrating identity through various art forms

styles.name: Hyperrealism
styles.description: Photographic precision exceeding traditional realism in detail and clarity

styles.name: Impressionism
styles.description: Capturing light effects with visible brushstrokes, everyday scenes in natural settings

styles.name: Installation Art
styles.description: Site-specific, three-dimensional works that transform a space

styles.name: International Style
styles.description: Modernist architectural style emphasizing function, clean lines, and minimal ornamentation

styles.name: Kinetic Art
styles.description: Moving parts or optical illusions creating actual or perceived motion

styles.name: Land Art
styles.description: Environmental works using natural materials and landscapes

styles.name: Light and Space
styles.description: Art focusing on perceptual phenomena, often using light as primary medium

styles.name: Low Poly
styles.description: 3D graphics with minimal geometric shapes and angular aesthetics

styles.name: Lyrical Abstraction
styles.description: Fluid, spontaneous abstract painting emphasizing intuitive expression

styles.name: Magic Realism
styles.description: Realistic scenes incorporating supernatural or mysterious elements

styles.name: Mannerism
styles.description: Sophisticated, artificial style emphasizing elegant distortion and complexity

styles.name: Maximalism
styles.description: Complex, dense designs embracing excess and multiple layers of meaning

styles.name: Memphis Design
styles.description: 1980s style with bold colors, geometric shapes, and playful patterns

styles.name: Minimalism
styles.description: Simple geometric forms, limited colors, emphasis on materials and space

styles.name: Modern Gothic
styles.description: Contemporary take on gothic themes with dark, mysterious, and romantic elements

styles.name: Modernism
styles.description: Breaking with traditional forms and techniques in favor of experimental approaches

styles.name: Neo-Expressionism
styles.description: Revival of expressionist painting with intense emotions and raw technique

styles.name: Neo-Pop
styles.description: Contemporary revival of pop art themes with digital and commercial influence

styles.name: Neoclassicism
styles.description: Revival of classical antiquity, emphasizing order, symmetry, and simplified grandeur

styles.name: Op Art
styles.description: Optical illusions, geometric patterns creating movement effects

styles.name: Performance Art
styles.description: Live actions and events as artistic expression

styles.name: Pixel Art
styles.description: Digital art using precise, limited resolution blocks of color

styles.name: Pointillism
styles.description: Images created from small, distinct dots of pure color

styles.name: Pop Art
styles.description: Popular culture imagery, bold colors, commercial printing styles

styles.name: Post-Impressionism
styles.description: Bold colors, distinctive brushwork, emotional impact, and symbolic meaning

styles.name: Post-Minimalism
styles.description: Reaction to minimalism incorporating organic forms and process-based art

styles.name: Precisionism
styles.description: American style depicting industrial and architectural subjects with geometric precision

styles.name: Psychedelic Art
styles.description: Bright colors, swirling patterns, and optical effects inspired by hallucinogenic experiences

styles.name: Realism
styles.description: Accurate depiction of everyday life and ordinary people without idealization

styles.name: Renaissance
styles.description: Realistic proportions, perspective, light and shadow, classical themes and harmony

styles.name: Rococo
styles.description: Light, elegant, decorative style with pastel colors and delicate ornamentation

styles.name: Romanticism
styles.description: Emotional, dramatic landscapes and scenes emphasizing nature and individual expression

styles.name: Socialist Realism
styles.description: State-sponsored realistic art promoting communist values and ideals

styles.name: Steampunk
styles.description: Victorian-era industrial aesthetics with brass, copper, and mechanical elements

styles.name: Street Art
styles.description: Urban art forms including graffiti, murals, and public installations

styles.name: Suprematism
styles.description: Abstract art based on fundamental geometric forms and pure artistic feeling

styles.name: Surrealism
styles.description: Dreamlike scenes, impossible combinations, exploration of the subconscious

styles.name: Symbolism
styles.description: Mystical, dream-like works expressing emotional and spiritual ideas through symbols

styles.name: Synthetism
styles.description: Simplified forms, pure colors, and symbolic meaning over natural appearance

styles.name: Tonalism
styles.description: Landscapes emphasizing mood through subtle variations of color and tone

styles.name: Transavanguardia
styles.description: Italian neo-expressionist movement emphasizing mythic imagery and emotional intensity

styles.name: Ukiyo-e
styles.description: Japanese woodblock prints depicting everyday life, landscapes, and theatrical scenes

styles.name: Vaporwave
styles.description: Retro aesthetics, 80s/90s nostalgia, pastel colors, and digital surrealism

styles.name: Video Art
styles.description: Art using video and audio technology as the primary medium

styles.name: Visionary Art
styles.description: Art expressing mystical, spiritual, or inner visions often with fantastic imagery
